Authors: Michael Alexander Gerschwitz-Eidt, Joachim W. Kadereit
Title:
Species composition of Saxifraga sect. Saxifraga subsect.
Arachnoideae (Saxifragaceae) based on DNA sequence evidence
Keywords:
ecology, homoplasy, ITS, morphological characters,
rpl32trnL(UAG), Saxifraga, Saxifraga subsect. Arachnoideae,
Saxifragaceae, trnLtrnF
Abstract:
We investigated the species composition of Saxifraga sect.
Saxifraga subsect. Arachnoideae, a recently recognized taxon, using DNA
sequence data (ITS, trnLtrnF, rpl32trnL(UAG)). We conclude that the
subsection contains 12 species, i.e. S. aphylla, S. arachnoidea, S.
berica, S. facchinii, S. hohenwartii, S. muscoides, S. paradoxa, S.
petraea, S. prenja, S. presolanensis, S. sedoides and S. tenella. Of
these, we provide the first molecular evidence for the membership of S.
muscoides and S. prenja in S. subsect. Arachnoideae. We provide an
extended morphological characterization of the subsection and an
identification key to its species.
